channel.title: [Need Help] - Fixing Source Compiler
channel.description:
Current Compiler:
[code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
Error: [code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: [Need Help] - Fixing Source Compiler
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Omg I Rawr:

That is not an error, its just a note, everything is compiled.

What? It didn’t even compile. Their is an echo in his CMD that says ‘Finished!’, that’s all.

It believe it can’t find your java path. Sorry I suck with these type of compilers.

Read full topic
